snippet.title: Silver Bullet or Trojan Horse? The Effects of Inclusionary Zoning on Local Housing Markets
snippet.description:
* Silver Bullet or Trojan Horse? The Effects of Inclusionary Zoning on Local Housing Markets (Citations: 4)
Jenny Schuetz, Rachel Meltzer, Vicki Been
Many local governments are adopting inclusionary zoning (IZ) as a means of producing affordable housing without direct public subsidies. In this paper, we use panel data on IZ in the San Francisco metropolitan area and Suburban Boston to analyze how much affordable housing the programs produce and how IZ affects the prices and production of market-rate housing. The amount ...

snippet.title: Is a gay Oedipus a Trojan horse? Commentary on Lewes's "A special Oedipal mechanism in the development of male homosexuality."

snippet.title: Is a Gay Oedipus a Trojan Horse?: Commentary on Lewes’s A Special Oedipal Mechanism in the Development of Male Homosexuality
snippet.description:
* Is a Gay Oedipus a Trojan Horse?: Commentary on Lewes’s A Special Oedipal Mechanism in the Development of Male Homosexuality
David Schwartz
K. Lewes’s (1998) article is seen as an effort to locate the psychopathology and desiring patterns of some gay men in a variant of the Oedipus complex. This commentary questions the value of the Oedipus complex as a theoretical tool in the psychoanalytic formulation of male same-sex eroticism both on clinical and political grounds. It argues that the embedded ...
Journal: Psychoanalytic Psychology - PSYCHOANAL PSYCHOL , vol. 16, no. 1, pp. 88-93, 1999
